Detailed Description

Abstract base class for action controllers.

Project EmeRails - Codename Ocarina

© 2008 Claudio Procida http://www.emeraldion.it

A subclass of BaseController is in charge of handling a set of actions. It creates the network of model objects that will be rendered by the views, handles and validates postback data, defines and applies before and after filters.

Definition at line 23 of file base_controller.php.

BaseController::before_filter ( $  filter,
$  params = NULL 
) [protected]

Registers a function as a filter to be executed before the action is invoked.

Action filtering

EmeRails allows the developer to call one or more functions before the action is actually invoked.

This may be useful to execute common code which is required before different action methods, to perform authentication checks, etc.

The controller keeps a list (FIFO) of filters that are invoked before the action method. Everywhere in the filters chain, you can redirect the request or simply return silently to resign control to the next filter, or the action itself. You can customize the way the filter is invoked by passing the optional parameter params.

Examples:

$this->before_filter(array('foo', 'bar'));

Executes the foo and bar filters (in this order) whatever action is requested.

$this->before_filter('foo', array('only' => 'index'));

Executes the foo filter only when the index action is requested.

$this->before_filter('foo', array('except' => array('index', 'list')));

Executes the foo filter unless the index or list actions are requested.

Parameters:
filter The name (or an array of names) of the method to be executed as filter. Currently, it must be a method of the controller.
params Parameters that define when the filter has to be invoked.

Definition at line 180 of file base_controller.php.

BaseController::after_filter ( $  filter,
$  params = NULL 
) [protected]

Registers a function as a filter to be executed after the action is invoked.

EmeRails allows the developer to call one or more functions after the action has been invoked.

This allows the developer to perform manipulation of the response, to enable markup expansion, etc.

The controller keeps a list (FIFO) of filters that are invoked after the action method has returned. Everywhere in the filters chain, you can redirect the request or simply return silently to resign control to the next filter, or the response be flushed to the client. You can customize the way the filter is invoked by passing the optional parameter params.

Examples:

$this->after_filter(array('foo', 'bar'));

Executes the foo and bar filters (in this order) whatever action is requested.

$this->after_filter('foo', array('only' => 'index'));

Executes the foo filter only when the index action is requested.

$this->after_filter('foo', array('except' => array('index', 'list')));

Executes the foo filter unless the index or list actions are requested.

Parameters:
filter The name (or an array of names) of the method to be executed as filter. Currently, it must be a method of the controller.
params Parameters that define when the filter has to be invoked.

BaseController::filter_applicable ( $  conditions  )  [private]

Determines if a filter is applicable for the current action.

This method checks the conditions argument in order to determine if the filter (whatever it is) can be applied for the current action.

Parameters:
conditions An array containing directives for the application of filters. It has the same format of the second parameter of methods before_filter and after_filter.

BaseController::redirect_to_referrer ( $  or_else = NULL  )  [protected]

Redirects the response to the URL which is contained in the HTTP_REFERER server variable (i.e., performs a back redirection). If no HTTP_REFERER is set, and if passed the optional parameter or_else, the latter is used for an explicit redirection.

Parameters:
or_else An URL, or an array with details of the action for response redirection if no HTTP_REFERER is set.

BaseController::link_to ( $  text,
$  params = array() 
)

Links to another action.

Hyperlinks to actions

This method creates a hyperlink to another action, as specified in the params argument. This params array has the same semantics used in the make_relative_url method. You can also provide an explicit URL for the hyperlink by passing the href key. This will override other parameters.

See also:
link_to_remote($text, $params);
Parameters:
text A text label for the hyperlink.
params Array of key value pairs defining the hyperlink.

Definition at line 452 of file base_controller.php.

References $text, a(), and make_relative_url().

BaseController::link_to_remote ( $  text,
$  params = array() 
)

Links to another action, with AJAX support.

This method behaves like link_to, except that it also adds an AJAX handler to replace the contents of the element with id target. You can also provide different URLs for the static and AJAX hyperlink, by explicitly setting the keys in params: href, remote_url, or both.

See also:
link_to($text, $params);
Parameters:
text A text label for the hyperlink.
params Array of key value pairs defining the hyperlink.

BaseController::make_relative_url ( $  params  ) 

Creates a URL to an action.

This method builds a URL to an action, as specified in the params argument. The params array has the following semantics:

controller: the name of the desired controller (optional, defaults to self). action: the name of the desired action (optional, defaults to 'index'). id: the id of the argument of the action (optional). type: the type (extension) of the resource (optional, defaults to 'html'). query_string: the query string part of the URL (optional). hash: the target HTML anchor of the URL (optional).

Parameters:
params Array of key value pairs defining the URL.

Definition at line 572 of file base_controller.php.

BaseController::render ( $  params  ) 

Requests the rendering of the response.

Response rendering

This method is responsible of loading the view and layout relative to the current controller and action, parsing their content, and returning the result to be appended to the response.

The params array has the following semantics:

  • action: the name of the action for which render a view (defaults to current action).
  • layout: the layout used to render the view (optional, defaults to current action). It can be set to NULL to render the view with no layout (the same result can be obtained using the nolayout request parameter).
  • return: return the rendered view as a string, rather than flushing it to the output buffer.
  • partial: triggers the partial rendering mode (optional).
  • object: passes an argument to be used by the partial view (optional).
Parameters:
params Parameters defining how the rendering should be realized.

BaseController::render_as_string ( $  params  ) 

Requests the rendering of the response as a string.

This method calls render by passing the return parameter to TRUE, and returns the rendered response as a string. The params array has the same semantics discussed in the render method.

Parameters:
params Parameters defining how the rendering should be realized.

BaseController::render_layout ( $  params  )  [protected]

Renders the layout for the current view.

This method is responsible of loading the layout as defined in the params argument, parsing it and returning the result. The params array has the same semantics of the render method, although only the layout key is relevant.

Parameters:
params Parameters defining how the rendering should be realized.

Definition at line 746 of file base_controller.php.

References $rendered, and load_part_contents().

Referenced by render().

BaseController::render_page (  ) 

Renders the page as a response for the current request.

This method is responsible for building the response for the current request.

  • All before filters that are registered for the current action are executed.
  • If the current page is cacheable, and a cached version already exists in the caches, it is returned; otherwise it is rendered and eventually stored in the cache folder.
  • All after filters that are registered for the current action are executed.
  • Finally, the response is flushed to the client.

Definition at line 786 of file base_controller.php.

References cached_page_exists(), cached_page_filename(), HTTP::error(), filter_applicable(), and render().

BaseController::render_component ( $  params  ) 

Renders a view from a controller other than self.

This method renders a view from a controller other than self, for example when embedding a view into another view.

The params array has the same semantics of the render method, with the following additions:

controller: the name of the controller responsible for the view (defaults to self).

Parameters:
params Parameters defining how the rendering should be realized.

BaseController::flash ( $  message,
$  type = 'error' 
)

Shows a message to the user, with an optional type qualifier.

Messages handling

The flash is a facility to store messages that should be visualized as a result of some event, or as a response to the user's previous request.

Parameters:

type The type of the message (e.g. 'warning').

BaseController::compress (  )  [protected]

Compresses the response with gzip encoding.

Filters

This after-filter is capable of compressing the response with gzip encoding, in order to save bandwidth. If the client does not support gzip encoding, the response is not altered.
